newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - APRIL 3.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - APRIL 3.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- A delegation of the Hague international court visiting Hungary to evaluate the effects of Slovakia's Gabcikovo dam project is meeting Hungarian officials behind closed doors.
- The governmant is submitting a proposals today that trainee judges should have a longer period of practice and stricter assessment.

- Head of the European integration department of the foreign ministry Ferenc Somogyi said it had been practically decided that NATO negotiations with Hungary on joining the alliance will start in the autumn.
- Four of Hungary's five opposition parties began talks on a common national agricultural poilcy.
- Prime minister Gyula Horn has appointed Jozsef Szasz as the new head of the government information office.
